messages.subject: Re: Yet more genealogy questions
messages.msgSnippet: Oops, disregard that.  There were two Honda Tadatokis, the one who died in 1615 was AKA Tadatomo, and was Honda Tadatoki s Uncle. Solves that problem.  The
messages.messageBody:
Oops, disregard that. There were two Honda Tadatokis, the one who
died in 1615 was AKA Tadatomo, and was Honda Tadatoki's Uncle.
Solves that problem. The Tadatoki married to Senhime died in 1626.
Senhime was actually his half first cousin, once removed, by the
way.It looks like relations married with some frequency during the
sengoku period.

messages.subject: Re: Yet more genealogy questions
messages.msgSnippet: Got it, I misread legitimate child / hier (Chakushi) as nephew (Oi) - not sure how I did that.  But this may be a stupid question, but how did Senhime marry
messages.messageBody:
Got it, I misread 'legitimate child / hier'(Chakushi)
as 'nephew'(Oi) - not sure how I did that. But this may be a stupid
question, but how did Senhime marry both Tadatoki and Hideyori when
they both died in 1615? (also, was Tadatoki also known as Tadatoshi?
A.L. Sadler, in his biography of Ieyasu has it as Tadatoshi. Not
that I trust his spelling all that much...)

> heard of.All of the three sons you reffer to are hers.But the name
> Mitsmasa should be Mitsutaka.And Toshitsugi might be Toshitsugu.
>
> Senhime's spouse is Honda Tadatoki.He is the son of Tadamasa,not
> nephew.Tadamasa is the son of Tadakatsu.
>
> hope this helps
>
> Shinsei
>
>

messages.subject: Re: Yet more genealogy questions
messages.msgSnippet: Hello The author is right.The kanji Žq can be read as ne when it means mouse as one of the 12 eto mascots.And as I searched by the word ŽqX•P,some
messages.messageBody:
Hello
The author is right.The kanji q can be read as "ne" when it
means "mouse" as one of the 12 "eto" mascots.And as I searched by the
word qXP,some webpages says Nenehime is Tamahime's another
name.She is also called Tentoku-in.

Shinsei

messages.subject: Re: Yet more genealogy questions
messages.msgSnippet: The Japanese book I m looking at has her name in Kanji as Ko followed by the repeat the previous kanji, and the furigana says ne-  I ll try to put the
messages.messageBody:
The Japanese book I'm looking at has her name in Kanji as "Ko"
followed by the 'repeat the previous' kanji, and the furigana
says "ne-" I'll try to put the Japanese here in SHIFT-JIS: qXP
It says she married Maeda Toshitsune: í AKA Toshimitsu: õ
It has her as the second daughter of Hidetada. I'll post this to see
if the Kanji posts along with it, and then take a look at what I have
for Senhime again. And I'm starting to realize that A.L. Sadler is
not the best author to look to for correct English romaji spellings
of Japanese names...

messages.subject: Re: Yet more genealogy questions
messages.msgSnippet: Isn t she Tama-hime?Ne might be her another name ,but I have never heard of.All of the three sons you reffer to are hers.But the name Mitsmasa should be
messages.messageBody:
Isn't she Tama-hime?Ne might be her another name ,but I have never
heard of.All of the three sons you reffer to are hers.But the name
Mitsmasa should be Mitsutaka.And Toshitsugi might be Toshitsugu.

Senhime's spouse is Honda Tadatoki.He is the son of Tadamasa,not
nephew.Tadamasa is the son of Tadakatsu.

hope this helps

Shinsei

messages.subject: Yet more genealogy questions
messages.msgSnippet: Looking at the connection between the Tokugawa and the Maeda clans, I find that a daughter of Tokugawa Hidetada (Ne- or Nene- hime [1599- 1622]) married Maeda
messages.messageBody:
Looking at the connection between the Tokugawa and the Maeda clans, I
find that a daughter of Tokugawa Hidetada (Ne- or Nene- hime [1599-
1622]) married Maeda Toshitsune [1593-1658]. does anyone know if his
sons Mitsumasa, Toshitsugi, and Toshiharu were sons of Hidetada's
daughter?

Second question - Hidetada's daughter Senhime married Honda
Tadatoshi, a nephew of Honda Tadamasa. Does anyone know who his
father was (which brother of Honda Tadamasa)?


Thanks for any assistance!
